meanings.definition: In a manner lacking wisdom or good judgment.
meanings.sent1: She spent her money unwisely on unnecessary things.
meanings.sent2: He unwisely decided to skip studying for the test.
meanings.sent3: The cat unwisely tried to chase after a squirrel but got scared and ran away.
meanings.sent4: The driver unwisely ignored the warning signs and got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The hiker unwisely ventured off the trail and got lost in the woods.

meanings.sent1: He unwisely accepted the job offer without knowing the details.
meanings.sent2: She unwisely made a hasty decision without thinking it through.
meanings.sent3: The student unwisely chose the first answer on the test without reading all the options.
meanings.sent4: The chef unwisely added too much salt to the dish, ruining the flavor.
meanings.sent5: The explorer unwisely ventured into the cave without a flashlight and got stuck.
